message.content:
To calculate the average (also known as the mean) and standard deviation of a list of numbers in Python, you can use the `statistics` module from the Python Standard Library. If you don't have it installed, first install it using pip:
```bash
pip install statistics
```
Then you can use the following code:
```python
import statistics

# Example list of numbers
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

# Calculate the average (mean)
average = statistics.mean(numbers)
print("Average:", average)

# Calculate the standard deviation
std_deviation = statistics.stdev(numbers)
print("Standard Deviation:", std_deviation)
```
This code will output the average and standard deviation of the list of numbers:
```
Average: 3.0
Standard Deviation: 1.4142135623730951
```
